column4: Precious metals miners set new peaks  Randgold hits record high
column5: LONDON  July 4 London-listed shares of precious metals miners advanced to new highs on Monday  tracking gains in gold and silver prices  with Randgold Resources climbing to a record high and Fresnillo at its best level since late 2012.

column4: Tesla's deliveries miss target again amid production ramp-up
column5: July 3 Tesla Motors Inc missed its vehicle delivery target for the second consecutive quarter and is on track to fall short of its annual target  suggesting the U.S. electric car maker is still wrestling with production issues as it looks to transform itself into a mainstream  high-volume manufacturer.

column4: EMERGING MARKETS-Brazil stocks rise as CPFL jumps in thin trade
column5: By Bruno Federowski and Paula Arend Laier     SAO PAULO  July 4 Brazilian equities rose on Monday as shares of CPFL Energia SA jumped on news that the world's largest utility  China's State Grid International Development Ltd  will buy a controlling stake in the company for 5.85 billion reais ($1.8 billion).     CPFL led the gains in Brazil's benchmark Bovespa stock index  after Camargo CorrÃªa SA agreed to sell a 23 percent stake in the country's largest power distributor to the Chine

column4: Delphi  Linamar to build new plants in Morocco: minister
column5: CASABLANCA Canada's Linamar Corp will build a 2.7 billion dirhams ($280 million) plant in Morocco to make engine parts  Morocco's industry minister said on Monday.

column4: CORRECTED-Diageo invests in non-alcoholic spirit brand
column5: LONDON  July 4 Britain's Diageo  maker of Johnnie Walker whisky and Smirnoff vodka  has invested for the first time in a non-alcoholic spirits brand.

column4: UPDATE 3-Detroit's Big Three report higher Canadian sales
column5: MONTREAL  July 4 Detroit's Big Three automakers on Monday reported higher Canadian sales for June and for the first half of 2016  on an annual basis  with forecasters expecting another record-breaking year.

column4: UPDATE 1-Brazil's Gol still looking for solution to debt issues -CFO
column5: SAO PAULO  July 4 Brazilian airline Gol Linhas Aereas SA is still looking for ways to resolve its costly debt load  a senior executive said on Monday  renegotiating bank loans this month after about 20 percent of bondholders accepted a restructuring.

column4: Brazil's Gol still looking for solution for debt issues -CFO
column5: SAO PAULO  July 4 Brazilian airline Gol Linhas Aereas SA is satisfied with the results of a debt swap involving about 20 percent of its bondholders  but the company is still looking for ways to resolve its overall debt situation  Chief Financial Officer Edmar Lopes Neto said on Monday.

column4: Brazil's Gol says bondholders tendered $174.7 mln of bonds in swap deal
column5: BRASILIA  July 4 Brazilian airline Gol Linhas Aereas Inteligentes SA on Monday said creditors agreed to swap $174.7 million in notes and bonds in a debt restructuring offer concluded last week.

column4: Fiat Chrysler and Honda report higher June Canadian sales
column5: MONTREAL  July 4 Fiat Chrysler Automobiles  and Honda Motor Co Ltd both on Monday reported a 2 percent rise in June Canadian sales  compared to the same month in 2015  because of increased demand for light trucks.

column4: Singapore's Temasek eyes U.S. investments to offset first portfolio drop in 7 years
column5: * Temasek portfolio expected to show first drop in value in 7 yrs

column4: Line sets higher IPO price range  to raise up to $1.3 bln -filing
column5: TOKYO  July 4 Line Corp has raised the tentative price range for its initial public offering with the IPO to be worth as much as $1.3 billion  a regulatory filing showed on Monday  in a sign of strong demand for shares of the Japanese messaging app firm.

column4: Britain could import 93 pct of its gas by 2040 - National Grid
column5: LONDON  July 5 Britain could rely on other countries for 93 percent of its gas supplies by 2040 if there is weak economic growth and not enough money available to support domestic gas production  National Grid said on Tuesday.

column4: BRIEF-Morphosys shares up 4.4 pct after Novartis milestone payment

column4: Novo Nordisk invests $60 mln to expand insulin plant in Kalundborg
column5: * Danish pharmaceutical company Novo Nordisk is investing 400 million Danish crowns ($59.70 million) in a 500 square meter extension of the world's largest insulin production plant in Kalundborg  it said on Monday.

column4: Petrobras puts nine shallow water concessions up for sale
column5: SAO PAULO  July 4 Brazil's state-run oil company Petroleo Brasileiro SA has put up for sale the rights to explore  develop and produce oil and natural gas from nine shallow water concessions  according to a securities filing on Monday.

column4: Petrobras' Indian partners fight delay in troubled Brazil oil project
column5: RIO DE JANEIRO/NEW DELHI  July 4 Petrobras has warned its Indian partners in a huge offshore project to not expect oil from the site until 2022  according to sources  a fresh sign of how low oil prices and the state-owned company's corruption scandal and mountain of debt are dragging on Brazil's energy industry.

column4: Poland closer to clinching $5 billion missile deal with Raytheon: minister
column5: WARSAW Poland has made significant progress in its talks with U.S. defense firm Raytheon  over a $5-billion missile defense system  Polish Defence Minister Antoni Macierewicz said on Monday.

column4: Poland closer to clinching $5 bln missile deal with Raytheon :minister
column5: WARSAW  July 4 Poland has made significant progress in its talks with U.S. defence firm Raytheon  over a $5-billion missile defence system  Polish Defence Minister Antoni Macierewicz said on Monday.

column4: Rio Tinto chief shelves giant Guinea iron ore project: newspaper
column5: CONAKRY Rio Tinto has shelved its $20 billion Simandou iron ore project in Guinea because of a sustained slump in prices  the company's new Chief Executive Jean-Sebastien Jacques said in an interview with The Times newspaper.

column4: UPDATE 1-Rio Tinto chief  shelves giant Guinea iron ore project -newspaper

column4: RBS would only move "tens" of employees post Brexit - CEO
column5: LONDON  July 4 Royal Bank of Scotland  Chief Executive Ross McEwan said the bank may have to move a small number of staff overseas and called for an end to the uncertainty gripping the main political parties following Britain's vote to leave the European Union.

column4: Indian shares end higher on global cues  Tata Motors gains
column5: July 4 India's NSE index rose to a 10-month high on Monday as Tata Motors rallied after posting stellar auto sales for June  with broader sentiment underpinned by a continued recovery in global markets from Britain's shock vote to leave the European Union.

column4: India's NSE index rises to 10-mth high; Tata Motors gains
column5: * Domestic reforms  prospect of more ECB easing buoy sentiment

column4: Spain's Almirall eyes Valeant skin drugs to boost dermatology
column5: MADRID Spanish drugmaker Almirall  which is building up its business in skin treatments  could be interested in acquiring dermatology assets from Canada's Valeant Pharmaceuticals  the head of the Barcelona-based company said on Monday.    Valeant is looking at divesting various products as it tries to reduce its massive debt load  with new CEO Joe Papa open to selling a range of assets if the price is right.

column4: Father of toddler killed at Disney resort says two alligators were involved
column5: The distraught father of a 2-year-old boy dragged off and killed by an alligator at the Walt Disney World Resort in Florida last month has said he was attacked by a second alligator as he fought to save his son.

column4: Father of toddler killed at Disney resort says two alligators were involved
column5: July 3 The distraught father of a 2-year-old boy dragged off and killed by an alligator at the Walt Disney World Resort in Florida last month has said he was attacked by a second alligator as he fought to save his son.
